sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均有"脏的，污秽的"之意。
means: dirty ： 普通用词，泛指被玷污或弄脏。
foul ： 指由于腐烂、恶臭等造成的不干净，令人恶心。
nasty ： 主要指特别讲究清洁的人感到讨厌的东西。

sentence.Network_en: They've picked up a really nasty infection from something they've eaten.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们因吃错东西而得了很严重的感染症。

sentence.Network_en: Though he had a temper and could be nasty, it never lasted.
sentence.Network_cn: 虽然他爱发脾气，而且有时还很讨厌，但向来都只是一阵儿。

sentence.Network_en: This was a nasty attack and the woman is still very shocked.
sentence.Network_cn: 这是一次恶意袭击，那女人仍然惊骇不已。

phrase.cizu_name: a nasty piece (或 bit) of work

jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)令人不快的人；不值得信赖的人

phrase.cizu_name: a nasty taste in the mouth

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English; of unknown origin

entry.tran: 令人不快的;令人厌恶的;恶劣的
entry.def: Something that is nasty is very unpleasant to see, experience, or feel.

example.tran: 这场离婚可能会撕破脸。

entry.def: If you describe a person or their behaviour as nasty, you mean that they behave in an unkind and unpleasant way.

example.ex: What nasty little snobs you all are...
example.tran: 你们全都是些可恶的势利小人。

entry.tran: 邋遢的;低劣的;下流的;污秽的
entry.def: If you describe something as nasty, you mean it is unattractive, undesirable, or in bad taste.

example.tran: 埃米莉在巴勒姆的脏乱小屋

example.ex: That damned Farrel made some nasty jokes here about Mr. Lane.
example.tran: 那个该死的法雷尔开了些关于莱恩先生的下流玩笑。

entry.def: A nasty problem or situation is very worrying and difficult to deal with.

example.ex: A spokesman said this firm action had defused a very nasty situation.
example.tran: 一位发言人称这一坚决的行动缓和了极为棘手的局面。

entry.def: If you describe an injury or a disease as nasty, you mean that it is serious or looks unpleasant.

example.ex: My little granddaughter caught her heel in the spokes of her bicycle — it was a very nasty wound...
example.tran: 我小孙女的脚跟夹到自行车的轮辐里了，伤得很严重。

example.ex: Lili had a nasty chest infection.

entry.tran: 令人不快的人(或事);危害别人的人(或事)
entry.def: Nasties are unpleasant or harmful people or things.

example.tran: 充斥着恶棍的邪恶组织

example.ex: Decaffeinated coffee still contains some stimulants and other nasties linked with cancer.
example.tran: 脱咖啡因的咖啡仍含一些刺激物和其他可能致癌的有害物质。

sentences.sentence: "Will he say nasty things at my funeral?"- Ezra Pound

means.word_mean: 2. exasperatingly difficult to handle or circumvent;

sentences.sentence: "a good man to have on your side in a tight situation"
"filthy (or foul or nasty or vile) weather we're having"

means.word_mean: 5. disgustingly dirty; filled or smeared with offensive matter;

auth_sentence.res_content_con: But at least it's not nasty or disgusting.

Sentence.sentence: But steamships didn't lose their sails until the 1880s, because early marine engines had a nasty habit of breaking down.

means.word_mean: 令人讨厌的; 令人厌恶的

sentences.en: Try to get rid of your nasty cold.
sentences.cn: 想法除去你那讨厌的感冒。

means.word_mean: 恶意的; 恶毒的; 卑鄙的

sentences.en: The joke is a nasty hit at him.
sentences.cn: 这个玩笑对他而言是个恶毒的讽刺。

means.word_mean: 严重的; 危险的; 造成痛苦的

sentences.en: She got a nasty knock on the head when she fell.
sentences.cn: 她跌倒时头部受到严重碰撞。

means.word_mean: 下流的, 道德败坏的

sentences.en: They'd be laughing making nasty remarks, and make passes at her.
sentences.cn: 他们会笑着说下流话, 并对她非礼。

jushi.english: She got a nasty knock on the head when she fell.
jushi.chinese: 她跌倒时头部受到严重碰撞。

jushi.chinese: 这个玩笑对他而言是个恶毒的讽刺。

jushi.english: Try to get rid of your nasty cold.
jushi.chinese: 想法除去你那讨厌的感冒。
